content.question: Vertex A of the triangle is at (4 comma 5). Vertex B of the triangle is at (negative 1 comma 4). Vertex C of the triangle is at (5 comma 3). A triangle with vertices <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C"><mi>C</mi></math> is given in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane. The vertices can be expressed as a <math alttext="2 by 3"><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>3</mn></math> matrix of column vectors. The mapping of <math alttext="open angle brackets x comma y close angle brackets"><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> to <math alttext="open angle brackets negative x comma negative y close angle brackets"><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> maps the vertices of the triangle so that the image of the transformation is a rotation of <math alttext="pi"><mi>π</mi></math> radians counterclockwise about the origin. Which of the following gives the image vertices as a matrix of column vectors?
